Description: Appends the specified string to this sequence.
Inserts the specified string at the specified position.
Replaces the characters in a substring of this sequence.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello World"); sb.replace(6

Description: Removes the characters in a substring of this sequence.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello World"); sb.delete(5

Description: Removes the character at the specified position.
Reverses the sequence of characters in this sequence.
Sets the character at the specified position to the specified value.
Returns a new string containing the subsequence of characters.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello World"); sb.substring(0

Description: Returns the current capacity of the sequence.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(); int capacity = sb.capacity();

Description: Returns the character at the specified index.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello"); char c = sb.charAt(1);

Description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified string.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello World"); int index = sb.indexOf("World");

Description: Returns the index of the last occurrence of the specified string.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello World World"); int lastIndex = sb.lastIndexOf("World");

Description: Returns the length of the character sequence.
Example Usage: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("Hello"); int len = sb.length();

Description: Sets the length of the character sequence.
Ensures that the capacity is at least equal to the specified minimum.
Attempts to reduce storage used for the character sequence.
